oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RF Sputtered Iridium (Ir) Film as a Counter Electrode for Dye-Sensitized Solar Cells
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOKURALA, K
KAMBLE, A
BHARGAVA, P
MALLICK, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: EFFICIENCY
CATALYSTS
Dye-sensitized solar cells
counter electrode
electrochemical characterization
semiconductors
solar energy materials and I-V characteristics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Iridium (Ir) films were deposited on fluorine-doped tin oxide substrate by radio-frequency sputtering at room temperature and the as-deposited films were used as counter electrodes (CE) for dye-sensitized solar cells (DSSC). The photo conversion efficiency (PCE) of DSSC fabricated with Ir-based CE was 7.2%. Electrocatalytic activity and electrochemical data for Ir-based CE were compared with those for conventional Pt-based CE. The results were indicative of potential use of Ir as an alternative CE material for DSSC.
